title: English (1841) New Literal Translation of Epistles (Macknight) Epistles
description: English (1841) New Literal Translation of Epistles (Macknight): James Macknight, a notable minister in the Church of Scotland during the eighteenth century, is renowned for his comprehensive commentary on the apostolic epistles. Initially published in 1795, Macknight's work represents the culmination of 30 years of extensive study and scholarship. This significant commentary offers in-depth analysis and interpretation of the New Testament epistles, ranging from Romans to Jude. T. F.
